intro: Cylindrokelupha poilanei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually borne on terminal inflorescences and bloom during the warm season. Cylindrokelupha poilanei is well adapted to humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
